qas.question: When was the Patriot Act passed?
What did the Patriot Act make it easier for law enforcement to search?

answers.text: telephone, e-mail communications, medical, financial, and other records

qas.question: What did the Patriot Act make it easier to do to immigrants?

answers.text: detaining and deporting immigrants suspected of terrorism-related acts

qas.question: How was the definition of terrorism expanded by the Patriot Act?
Which newspaper revealed the Terrorist Finance Tracking Program?
What bill increased restrictions on law enforcement agencies?
What bill did the Secretary of the Treasury pass?
What year was the Terrorist Finance Tracking program discontinued?
What program does the NSA currently use to monitor financial activity?
What newspaper uncovered the Patriot Act?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The USA PATRIOT Act<b6_0/><b5_0/> of <a0_0><b7_0>October 2001<b7_0/><a0_0/> dramatically reduces restrictions on law enforcement agencies' ability to search <a1_0>telephone, e-mail communications, medical, financial, and other records<a1_0/>; eases restrictions on foreign intelligence gathering within the United States; expands the Secretary of the Treasury's authority to regulate financial transactions, particularly those involving foreign individuals and entities; and broadens the discretion of law enforcement and immigration authorities in <a2_0>detaining and deporting immigrants suspected of terrorism-related acts<a2_0/>. The act also expanded the definition of terrorism <a3_0>to include domestic terrorism<a3_0/>, thus enlarging the number of activities to which the USA PATRIOT Act's expanded law enforcement powers could be applied. A new <b8_0>Terrorist Finance Tracking Program<b8_0/> monitored the movements of terrorists' financial resources (discontinued after being revealed by <a4_0><b9_0>The New York Times<b9_0/><a4_0/>). Global telecommunication usage, including those with no links to terrorism, is being collected and monitored through the NSA electronic surveillance program. The Patriot Act is still in effect.
